pr_title: GEODE-8020: buffer corruption in SSL communications

timeline.message:
GEODE-8020: buffer corruption in SSL communications

revert change in GEODE-6661 that made NioSslEngine use a direct buffer.
This class is not designed to share its buffer with a pool in
BufferPool.  Connection is also modified to use a heap buffer for
reading encrypted SSL packets for consistency.  New tests ensure that
these buffers are the correct type when using SSL or plain sockets.

timeline.bodyText: Is it intentional to increase the verbosity of this log message?
timeline.author: pivotal-jbarrett

replies.bodyText: yes!  I only saw the SSLException that explained the message-loss when debug-level logging was enabled.  With this log level change I had to augment isIgnorableException to filter out some exceptions being caught here when the socket was closed.
replies.author: bschuchardt

timeline.bodyText: The commit message references reverting the direct buffer changes. Is this change intentional because it doesn't look like part of the reverted commit?
